Stress - Lifespan hits?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 4 Archive (PS2): Research on game mechanics: Stress - Lifespan hits?
By Harrabcat on Friday, January 9, 2004 - 04:38 pm:

Ok Yet another day yet another experiment this one measuring the effect of lifespan hits. Guess what... I FOUND SOMETHING!!!

Ok First I found out that all my pixies who have not serious temper Always spit when I scolded them and the pixies that have normal tempers always threw a hissy fit when I scolded them (hmm.....)

Using T6-T10 Pixies (refer to Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 4 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here) : Pixie Lifespan Tests for more information) T10 and T7 sat this one out as baseline pixies. Heres my logs.

8mo1wk: T6 Scolded 5 times
T6 Frustrated
8mo3wk: T8 Scolded 5 times
T8 Frustrated
T8 Scolded ANOTHER 2 times
T8 Irritated
8mo4wk: T8 Frustrated
T9 Scolded 5 times
T9 Frustrated
9mo1wk: T9 scolded 4 times
T9 Frustrated
T9 Scolded another 3 times
T9 Irritated
9mo2wk: T9 Irritated
T9 scolded 6 times
9mo3wk: T9 Retired at age 4yr1mo3wk
10mo1wk: T6, T7, T8, T10 Retired at 4yr2mo1wk

The pixies were rested this whole time. I kept all variables that were in the experiment the same.

As you can see (or not see) T9 Did take a 2 week lifespan hit but nobody else did. I dunno what to think of this data but I do know this needs more testing. Another Test another day. Happy Ranching
